text:
68M with ETOH cirrhosis awaiting a liver transplant presents with 1
   week of abdominal pain. His pain is mainly in his midabdomen and right
   side of the abdomen. On the day of admission he underwent paracentesis
   which ruled out SBP. A CT scan obtained to evaluate for a cause of
   nausea revealed a
   non-occlusive thrombus in the SMV extending into the proximal portal
   vein.
   Transferred from [**Hospital Ward Name 289**] 10 to SICU B for hypotension, a 10 point HCT
   drop, and altered mental status.
   Abd and head CT this afternoon.
   .
   PMH: ETOH cirrhosis w/ ascites on transplant list, portal
   hypertension, varices, splenomegaly, HTN, cardiac stress [**2156**]
   negative, ECHO [**12-29**] EF >60%, Diabetes, Asthma/COPD, Allergic
   rhinits, Arthitis
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Patient confussed and combative.
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Anemia, other
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Cirrhosis of liver, alcoholic
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
